All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.8: Orphans and Vulnerable Children. Activities are aimed at improving the lives of orphans and other vulnerable children (OVC) affected by HIV/AIDS, and doing so in a measurable way. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.2: Sexual Prevention - Abstinence/Be Faithful. Activities (including training) to promote abstinence, fidelity, reducing multiple and concurrent partners, and related social and community norms that impact these behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.5: Sexual Prevention - Other Sexual Prevention. Other activities (including training) aimed at preventing HIV transmission including purchase and promotion of condoms, STI management (if not in palliative care settings/context), messages/programs to reduce other risks of persons engaged in high-risk behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.17: Pediatric Care and Support. All health facility-based care for HIV-exposed children and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. objectives

The project will target OVC and their family members who are infected or affected by HIV and AIDS. This will be an integrated project with components of OVC and care and support. The project will strengthen linkages and promote access to HIV prevention, care, treatment services and provide support services to mitigate the impact of HIV and AIDS on OVC and their family members. Care and support services will mainly target adolescents living with HIV. The OVC component of the project and HIV clinics will be used as platforms to target adolescents living with HIV. The project will be implemented at the community level by a prime partner that has yet to be determined. The partner will use evidence-based methodologies to deliver services. The project will work within the 13 PEPFAR priority districts to provide comprehensive care and support services to OVC and their family members. The specific districts of operation will be determined once the design of the project is complete. For target setting purposes, the following health districts have been used: Tutume, Kweneng East, Bobirwa, Serowe/Palapye, Gaborone and Mahalapye. These health districts have a high burden of HIV and high numbers of OVC. The project will report on the required PEPFAR indicators as required by PEPFAR.
